an3.106:4.1: “Mendicants, there are ascetics and brahmins who don’t truly understand the worlds’ gratification, drawback, and escape for what they are. I don’t consider them to be true ascetics and brahmins. Those venerables don’t realize the goal of life as an ascetic or brahmin, and don’t live having achieved it with their own insight.
an3.106:4.2: There are ascetics and brahmins who do truly understand the worlds’ gratification, drawback, and escape for what they are. I consider them to be true ascetics and brahmins. Those venerables realize the goal of life as an ascetic or brahmin, and live having achieved it with their own insight.”
